definitions: special uniform worn by servants or employees of a particular organization
service that provides vehicles with drivers for hire or rental
examples: The hotel staff wore elegant livery with gold buttons
The chauffeur's livery matched the car's interior colors
The wedding party booked a livery service for transportation
Several livery cars were waiting outside the airport terminal

definitions: animals kept on a farm for agricultural purposes including cattle sheep pigs and poultry
examples: The farmer counted his livestock before the winter season
They invested heavily in livestock rather than crop farming

definitions: small to medium-sized reptile with dry scaly skin four legs and a long tail
examples: A green lizard basked on the warm rock in the sun
The children watched the lizard catch insects with its tongue

definitions: domesticated pack animal from South America with long neck thick wool and gentle temperament
examples: The llama carried supplies up the steep mountain trail
Children loved feeding the friendly llamas at the petting zoo

definitions: heavy machinery designed to move and load materials like dirt or rocks
person whose job involves loading goods or materials onto vehicles
examples: The construction crew used a front-end loader to clear debris
The loader scooped gravel into the waiting dump trucks
The warehouse hired extra loaders during the busy season
Each loader was responsible for filling their assigned trucks

definitions: process of putting cargo goods or materials onto a vehicle or container
way weight or stress is distributed on a structure or component
examples: The loading of the cargo ship took several hours to complete
Proper loading prevents damage during transportation
Engineers calculated the loading on each bridge support beam
The wing loading affects the aircraft's performance significantly

definitions: bread baked in one piece typically in a rectangular or rounded shape
examples: She bought a fresh loaf of whole wheat bread from the bakery
The recipe makes two loaves of banana bread

definitions: spending time lazily without working or making effort to be productive
examples: The manager caught several employees loafing during work hours
He spent the afternoon loafing around the house instead of studying

definitions: rich soil composed of sand silt and clay ideal for growing plants
examples: The garden thrived in the dark loam of the river valley
Farmers prefer loam because it retains moisture while draining well

definitions: process of lending something especially money to someone for temporary use
examples: The bank's loaning policies became stricter after the recession
She regretted loaning her car to her unreliable cousin

definitions: word adopted from one language and incorporated into another without translation
examples: The English word 'kindergarten' is a loanword from German
Many technology loanwords from English appear in other languages

definitions: feeling of intense dislike disgust or hatred toward someone or something
examples: His loathing for dishonesty made him a strict but fair judge
She couldn't hide her loathing when she saw the spoiled food

definitions: gentle high throw or hit that travels in an arc through the air
examples: The tennis player executed a perfect lob over her opponent's head
He threw a soft lob to his daughter learning to catch

definitions: person who tries to influence politicians or public officials on behalf of particular interests
examples: The environmental lobbyist met with senators about climate legislation
Several lobbyists waited outside the committee hearing room

definitions: rounded projecting part of an organ especially the brain ear or lung
examples: The doctor examined the lower lobe of the patient's right lung
She wore small earrings that didn't stretch her ear lobes

definitions: surgical operation involving cutting connections in the brain's frontal lobe formerly used to treat mental illness
examples: Lobotomy procedures were largely abandoned by the 1970s
The film depicted the tragic consequences of early lobotomy practices

definitions: large marine crustacean with muscular tail large claws and hard shell valued as seafood
examples: The restaurant served fresh lobster caught that morning
The lobster turned bright red when cooked in boiling water

definitions: particular place or locality especially with reference to events or circumstances
examples: The film used an exotic locale to enhance the romantic storyline
They chose a quiet locale for their weekend retreat

definitions: process of adapting products or content to meet specific local market requirements
examples: Software localisation involves translating interfaces for different countries
The company invested in localisation to expand into Asian markets

definitions: feature or characteristic peculiar to a particular locality including dialect customs or interests
examples: The author included many localisms to give the story authentic flavor
Preserving localisms helps maintain cultural diversity in language

definitions: particular position point or place in space especially a district or neighborhood
examples: The rare bird was spotted in several localities throughout the region
Each locality has its own unique character and community spirit

definitions: process of adapting products services or content to specific local markets or regions
examples: Game localization requires both translation and cultural adaptation
The marketing team focused on localization for each target country

definitions: act or process of finding determining or establishing the position of something
examples: Locating the source of the leak took several hours of searching
The GPS system assists in locating vehicles in real time

definitions: device or system used to find or determine the position of something
examples: The metal locator helped find pipes buried underground
Emergency locator beacons help rescuers find stranded hikers

definitions: lake or arm of the sea in Scotland often narrow and surrounded by mountains
examples: Tourists came from around the world to visit Loch Ness
The morning mist rose gently from the surface of the loch

definitions: situation where people are not allowed to enter or leave a building or area freely due to emergency
examples: The school went into lockdown after receiving a security threat
Many businesses struggled during the pandemic lockdown periods

definitions: small ornamental case worn on a necklace that opens to hold photographs or keepsakes
examples: She treasured the gold locket containing her grandmother's picture
The antique locket had been passed down through generations

definitions: action or process of fastening or securing something with a lock mechanism
examples: The automatic locking system engaged when the car started moving
Proper locking of the safety harness is essential before climbing

definitions: common name for tetanus a bacterial infection causing muscle stiffness especially in jaw
examples: Vaccination has made lockjaw extremely rare in developed countries
The old farmer warned about getting lockjaw from rusty nails

definitions: situation where employers prevent workers from entering workplace during labor dispute
examples: The factory lockout lasted three weeks before negotiations resumed
Players faced a lockout when contract talks with owners failed

definitions: person who makes repairs or installs locks and makes keys professionally
examples: The locksmith arrived quickly to help the family locked out
She called a certified locksmith to install new security locks

definitions: place where people are detained or confined especially a jail or temporary holding facility
examples: The suspect spent the night in the police station lockup
The old lockup had been converted into a tourist attraction

definitions: ability to move from one place to another using limbs or other body parts
examples: Scientists studied the locomotion patterns of various animal species
The injury affected his locomotion requiring months of physical therapy

definitions: powered rail vehicle used for pulling trains along railway tracks
examples: The steam locomotive chugged slowly up the mountain pass
Modern electric locomotives are more efficient than diesel ones

definitions: doctor or professional who temporarily fills in for another during absence
examples: The practice hired a locum while their regular doctor recovered
She worked as a locum to gain experience in different clinics

definitions: large grasshopper that migrates in vast swarms capable of destroying crops
examples: The locust swarm devastated crops across several farming regions
Ancient texts describe plagues of locusts darkening the sky

definitions: vein of metal ore in the earth especially one that is rich and worth mining
examples: Miners discovered a rich lode of silver in the mountain
The mother lode yielded millions of dollars worth of gold

definitions: small house or cabin especially in a rural or wilderness setting
local branch or meeting place of a fraternal organization
examples: They rented a cozy lodge near the ski slopes for vacation
The hunting lodge was nestled deep in the forest
He attended the monthly meeting at the Masonic lodge downtown
The lodge voted to support several local charity projects

definitions: person who pays rent to live in a room in someone else's house
examples: The elderly woman took in a lodger to help with expenses
The lodger had his own key and kitchen privileges

definitions: temporary place to stay or accommodation especially when traveling
examples: They found comfortable lodging near the conference center
The travel guide listed various lodging options for every budget

definitions: room or space directly under the roof of a house or building
degree of height or angle given to a ball when hit
examples: They converted the dusty loft into a bright art studio
The barn loft stored hay bales for winter feeding
The golfer added more loft to clear the water hazard
The club's loft determines how high the ball will fly

definitions: mathematical function showing the power to which a base number must be raised to produce given number
examples: Students learned to calculate logarithms before electronic calculators existed
The logarithm of 1000 to base 10 equals 3

definitions: book in which details of a trip journey or period of duty are recorded
examples: The ship's captain made daily entries in the official logbook
Truck drivers must maintain accurate logbooks of driving hours

definitions: person whose job is cutting down trees for timber
device that automatically records data over time
examples: The logger worked carefully to fell trees without damaging others
Experienced loggers know how to predict where trees will fall
The temperature logger recorded readings every hour for analysis
Data loggers help scientists monitor environmental conditions remotely

definitions: large sea turtle with a massive head found in warm ocean waters
examples: The loggerhead turtle returned to the same beach to lay eggs
Conservation efforts helped protect loggerhead nesting sites from development

definitions: commercial activity of cutting down trees for timber and transporting them
process of recording events or data systematically over time
examples: Sustainable logging practices help preserve forest ecosystems long term
The logging company replanted trees in all harvested areas
Error logging helps developers identify and fix software problems
The system administrator reviewed the server's logging data
